content.description: Start low to the left with good feet and low hands, work your way up and to the right on a series of micro-ledges, reach out for a tough pinch and pull hard to top out to the right of the stump. Great for warming up those fingers and toes on a cold day, be ready to test your edging skills as well.
content.location: About 50 feet the the left of the Crack Addict boulders, a large and relitvely bare face with a fallen log on top - can't miss it.

content.description: Many variations but the best starts far left and traverses Gunks-like holds (or crimps if you want extra challenge) ducking right under a small roof on the arete around onto a small rail on a quartz crystal face. Finish right pulling onto the top or reverse and go back for mileage. Fun rock!
content.location: Boulder is leftward of most in the area. 100 feet left of parking lot facing West.

content.description: Several cracks on this great stone. Excellent hand-jamming and finger cracks. Moss grows back fast here.
content.location: Straight head across the road from the parking lot.

content.description: In the forest near the Northwest Mt. Hor trailhead below Moose Mountain.
